cluster_classes.class_description: Processes and structures involved in the sexual reproduction of flowering plants, including pollination, flowers, pollen, and the reproductive role of plants.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Butterflies transfer pollen between flowers during pollination, helping plants reproduce via flowers, nectar, and pollen.

cluster_classes.class_description: Dynamic biological processes involved in the sexual reproduction of flowering plants, such as pollination that enables fertilization and seed formation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Butterflies transfer pollen between flowers during pollination, helping plants reproduce via flowers, nectar, and pollen.

members.entity_description: Biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers, often by organisms, enabling plant reproduction and helping maintain plant populations.

cluster_classes.class_description: Physical structures of flowering plants that participate in sexual reproduction, including flowers, pollen, and the plants that bear them.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Butterflies transfer pollen between flowers during pollination, helping plants reproduce via flowers, nectar, and pollen.

members.entity_description: Reproductive structures of plants that produce nectar and pollen visited by butterflies.
Plant reproductive grains carried by butterflies between flowers during pollination.
Organisms that produce flowers, nectar, and pollen and depend on pollination to reproduce.

args.new_description: Processes and structures involved in the sexual reproduction of flowering plants, including pollination, flowers, pollen, and the plants that bear them.
args.justification: All three classes describe the same conceptual domain of flowering plant reproduction, with one umbrella class and two finer-grained process/structure variants using identical evidence; merging them into a single class avoids redundant fragmentation and unifies entities like pollination, flowers, pollen, and plants under one coherent reproductive concept.
args.remark: Previously separate process vs structure subclasses (ClsR_fc192048, ClsR_703dd4b2) have been merged with the umbrella class (ClsC_414056f3) because the current schema does not support explicit subclassing and the distinctions were not used elsewhere; if future ontology layers support subtyping, this class could be re-factored into process/structure children.

args.justification: The merged class specifically concerns reproduction in plants (flowering plants), so a more precise Class_Group label 'Plant Reproduction' better captures its scope than the broader or inconsistent previous values 'Biological Reproduction' and 'Organism Reproduction'.

executed_decisions.justification: All three classes describe the same conceptual domain of flowering plant reproduction, with one umbrella class and two finer-grained process/structure variants using identical evidence; merging them into a single class avoids redundant fragmentation and unifies entities like pollination, flowers, pollen, and plants under one coherent reproductive concept.
executed_decisions.remark: Previously separate process vs structure subclasses (ClsR_fc192048, ClsR_703dd4b2) have been merged with the umbrella class (ClsC_414056f3) because the current schema does not support explicit subclassing and the distinctions were not used elsewhere; if future ontology layers support subtyping, this class could be re-factored into process/structure children.

executed_decisions.justification: The merged class specifically concerns reproduction in plants (flowering plants), so a more precise Class_Group label 'Plant Reproduction' better captures its scope than the broader or inconsistent previous values 'Biological Reproduction' and 'Organism Reproduction'.
